metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36322 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the FUSE filesystem implementation in the Linuxkernel before 5.10.6, aka CID-5d069dbe8aaf. fuse_do_getattr() callsmake_bad_inode() in inappropriate situations, causing a system crash. NOTE:the original fix for this vulnerability was incomplete, and itsincompleteness is tracked as CVE-2021-28950.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36322` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-67-generic - 5.4.0-67.75~18.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-162.170').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-67.75~18.04.1').
